name: Phlox
climate: Phlox thrive in moderate climates with regular seasonal changes.
They grow well in areas with warm summers and cold winters.
These plants are adaptable to mild coastal climates as well.
Phlox can withstand short periods of drought but prefer moist areas.
sunlight: Phlox require full sun to produce the best blooms and growth.
Partial shade is tolerated, but may result in fewer flowers.
Morning sunlight with afternoon shade can be ideal in hot areas.
Ensure they receive at least six hours of direct sunlight daily.
watering: Regular watering during dry periods is essential for Phlox health.
They prefer consistent moisture but should not be waterlogged.
Water the base of the plant to keep foliage dry, preventing disease.
A deep watering once a week is better than frequent shallow watering.
soil: Phlox grow best in well-drained, fertile soils rich in organic matter.
The soil should have a neutral to slightly acidic pH for optimal growth.
They can adapt to sandy loam or clay soil, provided drainage is good.
Mulching helps retain soil moisture and adds extra nutrients over time.
extra_care_tip: Deadheading spent flowers encourages a longer blooming season.
Divide clumps every few years to promote vigor and prevent overcrowding.
